snippet: A regional dispute over sharing the waters of a river in southern India is a further indication that the power of the Indian government as a mediator between squabbling states is being eroded.
abstract: A regional dispute over sharing the waters of a river in southern India is a further indication that the power of the Indian government as a mediator between squabbling states is being eroded.

headline.main: Indian River Dispute Pits Regional Control Against National Desires
